data.name: Agender_Description
data.value: A person who does not identify with any gender. Often prefers gender-neutral pronouns, such as 'they'.

data.name: Agender_Name
data.value: Agender

data.name: Androgyne_Description
data.value: A person whose gender identity or expression incorporates both masculine and feminine elements.

data.name: Androgyne_Name
data.value: Androgyne

data.name: Bigender_Description
data.value: A person who identifies with two genders, either simultaneously or switching between them over time.

data.name: Bigender_Name
data.value: Bigender

data.name: Cisgender_Description
data.value: A person whose gender identity aligns with the gender they were assigned at birth.

data.name: Cisgender_Name
data.value: Cisgender

data.name: Genderfluid_Description
data.value: A person whose gender identity is flexible and can change over time, expressing different genders at different moments.

data.name: Genderfluid_Name
data.value: Genderfluid

data.name: GenderNonconforming_Description
data.value: An umbrella term for people whose gender expression or identity does not align with societal expectations based on their assigned sex at birth.

data.name: GenderNonconforming_Name
data.value: Gender-nonconforming

data.name: Genderqueer_Description
data.value: A term used by people who reject traditional gender categories. Often overlaps with "non-binary" and can refer to anyone who is not cisgender.

data.name: Genderqueer_Name
data.value: Genderqueer

data.name: Intersex_Description
data.value: A person born with physical sex characteristics (such as chromosomes or genitals) that do not fit typical definitions of male or female bodies. Often assigned a gender at birth through medical intervention.

data.name: Intersex_Name
data.value: Intersex

data.name: NonBinary_Description
data.value: A person who does not identify exclusively as male or female. Non-binary people may feel they embody aspects of both genders or neither.

data.name: NonBinary_Name
data.value: Non-binary

data.name: Omnigender_Description
data.value: A person who identifies with many or all genders. "Pangender" is the more commonly used term today.

data.name: Omnigender_Name
data.value: Omnigender / Pangender

data.name: Questioning_Description
data.value: A person who is exploring or uncertain about their gender identity or expression.

data.name: Questioning_Name
data.value: Questioning

data.name: Transgender_Description
data.value: A person whose gender identity differs from the sex they were assigned at birth. Some transgender people transition physically, while others may not. Often referred to as 'trans' (e.g., trans woman, trans man).

data.name: Transgender_Name
data.value: Transgender (Trans)

data.name: TwoSpirit_Description
data.value: A term used in some Indigenous North American cultures to describe a person who embodies both masculine and feminine qualities, often seen as a distinct spiritual role within their communities.

data.name: TwoSpirit_Name
data.value: Two-Spirit
